title: Strictly Come Dancing scoring addressed by Dr Ranj Singh
text:
Dr Ranj was all of us watching Strictly (Picture: BBC/Splash)

Dr Ranj Singh has addressed the scoring on last week’s Strictly Come Dancing, admitting that he was very surprised by the outcome.

On last weekend’s show, the leaderboard was turned on its head, with Mike Bushell receiving a nine for his quickstep and David James picking up eights.

This, added to the voting, meant that Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell ended up in the bottom two and danced their final dance.

And Dr Ranj, who competed on the 2018 series of Strictly, was all of us when he tweeted: ‘Is it just me or are the comments and scores a bit… random?

‘I mean… don’t get me wrong, I LOVE watching everyone perform and they are all fab. But I feel like I’m watching a completely different show…’

The scores were all over the place (Picture: BBC)

Dr Ranj believes celebs have a responsibility to speak out (Picture: Splash News)

Speaking to Metro.co.uk at the Pink News Awards, the 40-year-old said: ‘I think we were all just really surprised. I’m surprised at the result, I think the nation is surprised at the result, but it just goes to show that anything can happen.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘If you want to keep someone in, you have to vote.’

And Dr Ranj’s vote is going towards his old partner Janette Manrara and Will Bayley – although he has some other favourites too.

The This Morning doctor said: ‘I’m always gonna vote Will and Janette. They are my frontrunners, they are the ones I want in the final. But, do you know what, Karim and Kelvin have good chances, and Michelle Visage is in with a good chance.

Dr Ranj is supporting Janette Manrara (Picture: PA/BBC)

‘It would be incredible to see an older lady in the final. The last time was Debbie McGee, and she was incredible – who knows, Michelle could carry that baton.’

Dr Ranj looked slick at the Pink News Awards, held at Church House in Westminster, wearing a bottle green suit with statement necklaces over a white shirt.

And he told us that he feels all LGBTQ+ celebrities have a responsibility to be vocal about issues in the community.

He said: ‘I don’t think anyone really wants to get on a soap box about it, but I think if you are part of any minority community and you have a platform, then you have an automatic responsibility to that community to make things better.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

On that note, Dr Ranj discussed the rise in hate crimes, with transgender hate crimes rising by 37% and crimes motivated by sexual orientation going up by a quarter over the past year.

‘I think it’s really really sad,’ he said. ‘And the shocking thing is that hate crimes across the board are going up, not just within the LGBT+ community. It’s something we need to sit up and pay attention to and something we actually need to do something about.

‘These are people’s lives and livelihoods we’re talking about. No-one deserves to be discriminated against or persecuted – especially in the UK, we’re supposed to be the developed world, we’re supposed to be leading the way with equal rights.’

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Dr Ranj Singh has addressed the scoring that led to Dev and Dianne being eliminated from Strictly Come Dancing.
